name: MistralAIModel

input.content: gitignore any file called .KEYFILE anywhere under a directory foo, which itself is anywhere

output:
To ignore any file named `.KEYFILE` located in any directory named `foo` or its subdirectories, you can add the following line to your `.gitignore` file:

```
foo/**/.KEYFILE
```

Here's the breakdown of the pattern:

- `foo/`: Matches the directory named `foo` at any level.
- `**/`: Matches any subdirectory (zero or more levels) under the `foo` directory.
- `.KEYFILE`: Matches the file named `.KEYFILE`.

This pattern will ignore any `.KEYFILE` file in the `foo` directory or any of its subdirectories, regardless of their depth.

name: WordEvaluator
input:

```
foo/**/.KEYFILE
```

Here's the breakdown of the pattern:

- `foo/`: Matches the directory named `foo` at any level.
- `**/`: Matches any subdirectory (zero or more levels) under the `foo` directory.
- `.KEYFILE`: Matches the file named `.KEYFILE`.

This pattern will ignore any `.KEYFILE` file in the `foo` directory or any of its subdirectories, regardless of their depth.
